intro: Jasione amethystina var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate amethyst bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive appearance.
